text.tspan: Visualization Checklist
1Color coding, Nature Methods 7(8):573, 2010
2Design of data figures, Nature Methods 7(9):665, 2010
3Salience, Nature Methods 7(10):773, 2010
4Gestalt principles (Part 1), Nature Methods 7(11):863, 2010
5Gestalt principles (Part 2), Nature Methods 7(12):941, 2010
6Negative space, Nature Methods 8(1):1, 2011
7Typography, Nature Methods 8(4):277, 2011
8The overview figure, Nature Methods 8(5):365, 2011
9Color blindness, Nature Methods 8(6):441, 2011
10Avoiding color, Nature Methods 8(7):525, 2011
Visualization Checklist by Bartosz Telenczuk is licensed under
Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.
To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/
Use of visual clues: Does the graph use strong and accurate visual clues such as
lentgths and positions?2
Data representation
Salience: Are the important patterns in the presented data emphasised by use of
salient visual features such as color, size, shape or added marks?3
Symbol uniqueness: Are the same symbols always used in the same context and
different symbols do not have overlapping meanings?8
Grouping: Do related objects, such as data points and labels look alike, are connected
by lines, placed close together or enclosed in a common space?4
Use of colors: Are the colors necessary and can not be replaced by positional marks
and/or lines?10
Colors
Color coding: Are the colors used in the presentation discriminable (also for color-
blind and in black&white print) and do not introduce bias or unwanted artifacts?1,9
Typeface: Is the typeface used consistently and does not interfere with reading?7
Typography
Grouping: Is the grouping principle (see above) correctly applied to figure panels?4
Layout
Arrangement: Are the figure elements aligned to (possibly implied) guides to
emphasise the flow of arguments and express the figure's underlying meaning?5
Use of whitespace: Is the whitespace regular and used effectively as a means to
attract readers' attention and make the non-white content stand out?6
References to related articles from "Points of View" series by Bang Wong:
